name: Dakota Zoo
address: 602 Riverside Park Rd, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: Went the first of March and so enjoyed the visit. Since it was cool out almost all those animals were out and the one who need warmth were inside exhibits. It made the visit really enjoyable to be able to see so many animals. I will say good walking, enclosed shoes are important here as the walkways are rough and broken in places (I fell once) and this early there was a lot of snow melt with flooded walkways making that not an enjoyable experience. Overall loved it!

I had no idea there would be a zoo in North Dakota! Our family visited it was a lot of fun. Great zoo, lots neat animals to see and great meeting rooms. Bring your sunscreen if it's during summer time

This zoo was amazing!  Coming from Wichita,is where the Sedgwick County Zoo is phenomenal, I found this zoo refreshing and unique.  It was amazing to see all the North American animals along with some exotics.  My wife and I will be bringing our kids with us in a couple of years to this zoo.

The zoo is okay.  It's small and the admission fee is very reasonable.  Good for some entertainment.  A lot of small enclosures which could do with some renovations.  Park is clean and well maintained.  Lots of shade. The tigers were the best part.

Went to go to take photos with Santa which we were led to think were free. Paid $19 to get in, saw a sign with the prices on it for pictures $10-25 (depending on what you wanted). Decided it wasn't worth almost $40 to take a photo with Santa, so I requested a refund for the zoo entry since we hadn't gone in. The lady stated she can't give refunds and that I would have to come back another day to get one. She then gave us a Supervisor's # to call, but when we tried to call, it wasn't an actual number. Moral of the story, don't try to get refunds, as they will make you jump through hoops to get it. I did get it in the end.

name: North Dakota Heritage Center & State Museum
address: 612 E Boulevard Ave, Bismarck, ND 58505, USA
reviews: A break from the road for some much needed culture. Beautiful modern facility with very warm and friendly staff. A great deal of educational and historical material   allowing for a wonderful experience. Ample parking and easily accessible from the highway. Well worth the detour. Thank you and good use of your $.
My kids love this place. Such a great place to go and explore on a cold winter day! They playground is a great bonus!
Very interesting place! Was so cool to look around the exhibits and see all the stuff they have to offer. Really cool experience. Really cool artifacts. Overall ready awesome place!
This place gets better everytime I visit. It's very accurate with some of the exhibits. But a great place to visit.

1 to 6 hours of awesome! You can whip through this museum and still get something out of it. Or get lost in large warehouse-like rooms filled with great exhibits that continually provided organization, flow, and detail for me to understand and digest. Artifacts everywhere and I was told only 4% of what they have is on display at any one time. 

I spent about 4 hours total here and was most impressed with their North Dakota and WW1 exhibit. So interesting to put it in perspective and see how it had affected the people of ND. Also had so many artifacts that soldiers had brought back from war. 

Dont miss the petrified wood and natural cannonballs in the garden area.  And it is all free to see. Thank you North Dakota!

name: Gateway to Science
reviews: A lot of interesting science activity. You can do a bunch of interesting activities with your kids. It's not too big, and tend to get crowded. You can also pet a iguana there, and you can also learn about aquaponics, and if you get lost on the trivia quiz, the guy or girl at the gateway to science will help you solve the quiz. They also gonna expand the building and bring more exhibitions. Me, my wife, my daughter and my son have a fun time here!
Best place for kids of all ages to have fun while (even accidentally) learning about science. My children and now my grandchildren have always loved GTS!
Very cool exhibits for kids. Highly educational and experimental.

Great interactive displays for the money! Highly recommended for anyone!! The staff need huge attitude adjustments though—they tend to like to snatch your forms of payment  (and paid membership cards) from you then throw it back on the counter, so
Beware of Kim Eslinger.
Very interesting. I recommend it for anyone who is curious!

name: Keelboat Park
reviews: Nice walking trail. There is a great source of information about the area on many sculptures and statues. There could be more things to do. Even a shelter for picnics or something. Over all, a great place.
Great location to start a run or bike ride, convenient boat ramp, and the river boat is always a nice way to spend an evening. The sunsets aren't bad either.
Nice trail along the river to run, walk, or fish.
Kids love it and great views
Interesting. Was hoping for the keel of a boat but only found a replica off a partial boat no keel

name: Former Governors' Mansion State Historic Site
address: 320 E Avenue B, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: Beautiful house. There's an attendant there as well so if you have questions or anything he can help....the gentleman we had was very knowledgeable and friendly. There was no admittance fee. Plaques mounted to the walls to describe the different living areas. They've actually peeled away different layers of wallpaper and paint as well as the lath and plaster. Definitely worth stopping to see.
This is a must to see while visiting bismark. Tour guide was so informative.  It's like talking a walk back in time.free admission and very well keep
This Santa was wonderful. Spent real time talking with the children and nice tour of the historic governor mansion.
Interesting and very tight quarters...steep narrow staircase!!!

This a really cool place with detailed history about the governors of ND. The wormwood is beautiful. Seeing the different wallpapers of past decades will be interesting. Do not forget to check out the carriage house!

name: Buckstop Junction
address: 3805 E Bismarck Expy, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: It is a little ways out of the city, which helps to maintain it's atmosphere. It's a fun little historic town with lots of buildings. I went there for the Apple Fest, and each building had different activities or musicians for the event.
Well taken care of old buildings and antique equipment.
Great place to use as a venue or visit if you enjoy the history inside

Excellent place to visit that most people forget is right in plain sight!  The tour guides are very knowledgeable and for the low price you pay, there is so much to see!!  If you're in the bisman area, this is a great place to visit and help keep our local history alive!
Had a great time at the Halloween party today

name: Chief Lookings' Village
address: 2023 Burnt Boat Rd, Bismarck, ND 58503, USA
reviews: The beauty here is unrivaled.  This little gem of a park is tucked into a lovely residential area with spectacular views.  Don't miss it if you're in the area!
Fun and informative historical site. Also, perfect place to watch the sun go down! 😁
A great view and phenomenal place to watch the sunset
It is beautiful here! The view is amazing and there are a lot of great trails around for biking!!
One of the best trail systems in Bismarck, lots of ups and downs, and phenomenal views. It connects to the college trails, as well as the river road trail.

name: Sertoma Park
address: Riverside Park Rd, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews:
Sand volley , walking/jogging trails, picnic shelters you can rent for family get togethers , lots of swings and other playground fun, and restrooms close by.
Amusement Park in the middle of everything ; Big Slide, mini golf, fun rides and concessions... one of the best parks in Bismarck... let’s not forget the awesome Zoo right there too. Train rides available at the Zoo
Great place to have a walk. Working on losing 50 lbs. Like or contact me with your support. Or check meetup join me.

This is a well maintained park that has something for everyone, even an amusement park within the park (rare to see an amusement park, not a theme park nowadays, especially outside the East Coast). Parts of the original riparian forest are still preserved here. You can't go wrong spending a Sunday afternoon here.
Such a gem in our community. There's so much to do for ND! And it's relatively clean and well kept.
One of the best parks in town. Usually has a hustle bustle going. Full of people who will wave and occasionally stop and talk.

name: North Dakota State Capitol
address: 600 E Boulevard Ave dept 110, Bismarck, ND 58505, USA
reviews:
Another stamp in the boys state capitol books 😉
The elevators are a bit high tech here with a touch screen to request an elevator going up to the observatory floor (or back down). There's a bit to see here (mostly photos and views from the observatory) and the ND Heritage Center is a quick walk from the Capitol building.
I'll boost a review with pics for the heritage center separately since they are technically two separate areas.

A practical but beautiful state capitol building. Guided tours are available during limited hours but self guided tours are allowed as well. Visitors can access the observation level on the 18th floor for nice views of the town. Both chambers of the house and Senate are also open to view.

Cool place to check out. They have a free guided tour most hours. Or you can always self-guide yourself through this beautiful building founded in hard working North Dakotan spirit. Our tour guide was knowledge, informative, and obviously very proud of her home state. Great views on the top floor.
Check out next door while you're here.  ND Heritage Center and state museum. Also free and really well done.
Somewhat unique among capitol buildings in the United States with its high-rise design, the grounds are still very attractive and the capitol stately.
Closed when I arrived, but worth the walk around. Found the heritage museum on the grounds; a great surprise.

name: Camp Hancock State Historic Site
address: 101 E Main Ave, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: Lovely, peaceful grounds. A pretty covered open building housing the rail engine. Plenty of pigeons/doves roosting above it so don't get past the railing! There is also a gorgeous old church on the grounds and the weather service building. Lots of sweet scented peonies on the grounds, a well maintained lawn, the perfect tree to frame photos of the beautiful church from the back, a pair of soft stained glass windows complete the site. The railroad runs behind it and the front of the site is framed by the street with lamp post signs.
Nice place to go and see history of bismark nd. Check out the old church
Great history, beautiful church,  and the grounds nicely maintained.
I love history
This is a cool place in downtown Bismarck.

name: Bismarck Art & Galleries Association
address: 422 E Front Ave, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: Fun little art gallery with a regular rotation of local artists
Wonderful little gallery. It has a good meeting room.
Beautiful artwork in a very nice gallery.
Great place for local and other artists. What a gem in Bismarck.
Beautiful photographs of the national parks

name: Raging Rivers Waterpark
reviews: Excellent place! Good is cheap and don't have to wait long to eat.
This waterpark is really fun! All the features are truly enjoyable and there's lots of fun new people to meet for kids and adults! It's a great place to spend a hot day

The kids had a blast!! Cheap fun entertainment for the family. The lazy river was awesome! I was impressed with how clean and well kept the park was. It’s fun for all ages! Our party had an age range of 3-8 years old and all of them loved it.
Very fun, it's only 10$ after 4:00 so that's a good deal
Delicious concessions! Fun for the whole family! I could have stayed on the lazy river all day. Very relaxing and the perfect getaway. It wasn"t very busy either. Very impressed!

name: Fort Abraham Lincoln State Park
address: 4480 Fort Lincoln Rd, Mandan, ND 58554, USA
reviews: Great place to visit and see the views. Great campsites, rentable yurts, plenty to do. I love the trails at this state park for running and mountain biking, very gradual.

Tour of the Custer House was educational, informative and surprising!
Some of the owners pieces were actually in the home.
The guard house and mess hall were neat to see, reading all the info signs along with the stables was informative.
Good place to take the family.

Fun stop. Toured the old barracks and training grounds. Comfortable area with good parking. Small entrance fee was charged. The big hit was the generals house and all the artifacts and historical information. Additionally, the Indian village and museum was quite interesting. You will also find a gift shop at the location.

A bit pricey for a State Park.  We had only electric and water and it was $25 + $7 day use fee.  But the park was beautiful.  Some of the sites are crowded as they have 2 hook ups on many of the looped "pull thru" sites.  The back in ones are best and have nice views of the river.

I have been going to Fort Lincoln since I was a child (for the last 25 years or so) and it has only gotten better over the years. It has great places for hiking along with historical sites. Both Native American history as well as the history of Custer. Great place to take kids especially for picnics, camping or fishing.

name: SuperSlide Amusement Park
address: 500 Riverside Park Rd, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: What I expected for a family fun park. We wished there were enough workers to cover all the rides.  Some wait times were really month for the little kids rides. Batting cages were pretty outdated.  Overall fun and fair prices.
I have came here my whole life and love coming back every year when they open.
Great people great place
Great place to take the family. Even better if you combine it with the zoo!
Great place for everyone! You have to pay for batting cages, mini golf, and bankshot(can't use tickets).  Understaffed. But quite enjoyable!

name: Fort Lincoln Trolley
reviews: Such a fun day trip!  There is plenty of shade to wait in if you get there early. You can get off the trolley and take a later train back or stay on and go back right away.

Slow enjoyable ride, views along the route, beautiful.
Wildlife dotted between Mandan and Park
I love riding chu -chu treen I enjoyed! I recommended 👌
A fun way to do a day trip to Ft. Lincoln State Park
Nice trolley ride, 9 mile ride to Mandan from Fort Abraham Lincoln and back for $9 per person.  Rise along the Heart risk er beautiful scenery and wildlife.  We saw lots of deer.

name: Pioneer Park
reviews: Great place for a walk or just for fun.
Great place if you want to go for a walk, jog, run, or play volleyball.
Nice park
Beautiful park by the Missouri river. Bike and walking paths with shelters & play areas
Shaded trail, sand volleyball, picnic, parking playground. Good options.

name: New Generation Park
reviews: Excellent modern wild west theme playground. It has large areas for tots, preschoolers, and older kids plus wheelchair access and features. There is also a splash pad, public restrooms, picnic shelters, and reservable party room. There is a nice parking lot and additional street parking.
Great play areas for young children as well as older ones.  Lots of slides, climbing options and bridges.  Also a sand sifter, picnic area and skating rink.
The splash pad is so nice. Perfect for all ages and a great way to cool off. Also, it is free! The park area is great as well. They have two different sized parks so again great for all ages!
Nice playground, has a few different age appropriate areas all within sight. Community center was very nice!
Great place for our 2 and 4 yr old to run around  and play.  They loved the splash pad.  We'll definitely be back.

name: Tatley-Eagles Park
reviews: Gear park, especially since the addition of FOMO icecream! It is a truly idyllic space in town, with community gardens, volley ball, free yard games, softball spaces, a play ground. If you get a chance to just enjoy the evening while eating icecream at golden hour in this park... just do it.
Nice place to go camping for the weekend close to town but yet still quite enough you can enjoy time away from the hustle and bustle City living

Great park, I've played volleyball here a few years, and now there's a gelato stand here for the summer. Two baseball diamonds, two sand VB courts, a playground, an ice rink, and tons of room here for just about any activity you can think of.
Really nice place to hang out play volleyball here but wish the same was a little better
Fun at the park

name: Eagles (Universal) Park
reviews: What an amazing playground! Soft padding on the ground without small pieces getting stuck in the shoes. Good amount of shade and different options for all ages to entertain
So many fun things to play on...for all ages.

Excellent playground. The kids love the zip line. Lots of unique play structures to climb on. Unfortunately the benches are in the sun and the adults have to hangout under the play structure to get any shade.

This place was so much fun! The ground in the park was rubber and felt springy to walk on. The park had a lot of different play equipment both accessible and non it started low to the ground and went up higher as you climb through. It kept us busy for a long time! Cant wait to stop by again!
The grandkids had tons of fun and cant wait to return.

name: Wachter Park
reviews: Great place!  Play Equipment from ages 1 to  8+ !

ACCESSIBILITY #1! This park is from another planet on the disability access front. Those in wheel chairs and with limited mobility can roll right up the interactive & canopied play spaces. It can get busy but it has the capacity to accommodate MANY families at once with its multiple playgrounds. Great park in very safe neighborhood!
So many different equipment to play on for the kids.  A nice breeze and a swimming pool right next to it.
Just a great park
This park is clean and has tons of things to do from toddler to adult. Pool and ice rink

name: Optimist Family Park
reviews: Very family fun, smart thinking with the portapotties
Very open and well kept grrah for gatherings
So nice great for big kids and little kids! My daughter loved it! Don't forget to stroll around the water tower the view is beautiful
Nice park with play ground, sand volleyball, basketball, horseshoe and picnic benches.

It a very open park, my son and I love coming here. Its has a perfect playground set-up for children and adult playing areas also. Its great for picnics or outdoor meetings or birthday parties on a nice summer day.

name: North Dakota State Railroad Museum
reviews: Closed when we got there but a gentleman doing some maintenance gladly showed us around
Great place to visit plenty of old trains old buildings trains that were here before I was very interesting if you're into trains history show the state of they do try to answer questions you ask
It was a neat little area. Lots of awesome pictures and items from back in the day. Very cool history.
Visiting from California  this is the best train museum  I have ever been to. Lots of historical items.
Lots for kids to explore and experience. They have many railcars open to venture into and explore. Such a fun family outing!

name: T R Roughrider Hall of Fame
address: 600 E Boulevard Ave, Bismarck, ND 58505, USA
reviews: Pictures and plaques on the main floor of the capitol building commemorating North Dakotans for significant accomplishments

name: Johnny Gisi Memorial Park
address: 2601 E Calgary Ave, Bismarck, ND 58503, USA
reviews: Nice little gem. My kids love this park. Unfortunately, there is some maintenance that needs to be done and the city doesn't bother. Kids are too busy on their electronics at home to venture out.
Good parking space for access to the trail system. There is also a playground and some tennis courts, but I mostly use this area for trail access.
In a good area, so much space to roam. It's really peaceful and nice.
Great space for anyone to play or do some thing
Swings, tennis cou t, oicnic area, kids playground, sand box area

name: Double Ditch Indian Village State Historic Site
reviews: The area is clean, easy to navigate, and beautiful. There are plaques detailing the history about the site, and are very interesting to read. It's a medium sized walking area, and is good for a quick stop to soak in some scenery. The sun sets on the other side of the river, and can be viewed very well from here. There are benches to sit on as well. If you are passing through, I would recommend stopping here for a quick stroll.
Beautiful place to watch the sun set.  Poignant reminder of our history.
This is an amazing spiritual place, with beautiful views of the Missouri river! Rich in history of local indigenous people!
Nicely maintained trails and informational signs. Few benches. Watch for pocket gopher or squirrel holes.

It might seem a little barren but there's a ton of history behind this place. Fantastic view of the river, great place to get out and burn afew calories or even a nice place to go by yourself to relax.

name: DK Orthodontics
reviews: DK Orthodontics has been amazing with my 2 daughters and my son. We went to them for a second opinion and are so very glad we did. Dr Dan had the same treatment recommendation but much more reasonably priced and we love the staff! They are super friendly and caring. They truly care about their patients and want Ortho treatment to be a positive experience. My girls got their braces off in May and they actually miss going to see Dr Dan every couple weeks!
The people are amazing and polite! My teeth are straight and I highly recommend this orthodontist!

This place is wonderful, very personable!!! Extremely impressed!! They explained everything so well and showed us pictures and videos of what they will be doing to my daughter's teeth. I feel like I know all the details of how this process is going to go and won't have anything to worry about down the road!!! Thank you so much Dr. Dan and Danielle for being so awesome with Britt and I!!!

I want to thank Dr.Dan and his amazing staff! Since day one they have made me feel so welcome and part of their DK family! It was a bitter sweet day today, as I got my braces off. I was thinking of all the faces that I will miss seeing on early Monday mornings. Although, I will be a guest in his office as my children will be future patients, giving me even more of an opportunity to continue the friendships.  You do it right!!

Just got braces on our 13 yr old daughter today and couldn’t be more impressed with the dr. and staff at DK Orthodontics!  So friendly and helpful from day 1 with the initial consult.  They have been so kind in all their interactions w us, explaining thoroughly any questions we’ve had.  They remember us each time and ask how things are going.  THANK U, DK ORTHODONTICS, for everything!  Excited to see our daughters amazing smile in a couple of years 😁

name: Laughing Sun Brewing Co.
address: 1023 E Front Ave, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: Service is what kept this from being a 5-star. I don't mind ordering at the bar, but there was not enough staff resulting in a wait every time I went up because they were too busy doing other things to take my order.  And this was mid-afternoon on a weekday!  Food was good (could use more smoke flavor) with generous portions.  Nice facilities.

Nice atmosphere and good craft beer. Some of the food options on the menu are unique and fun. All that I have tried, taste pretty good, but none of it has been hot. Good flavors but the food is always just warm to warm-ish. My friends all feel the same way and some of them I have never been there with. Unfortunately if it stays consistent like that I will probably stop going there altogether.

They moved to a new Bismarck location in the Fall, and now they have a ton more room, and live music almost every night it seems! Just had the Taylor Made barbecue for the first time tonight (Chopped Brisket Sandwich) and holy smokes is it delicious! The Mac n Cheese will blow your mind too. Beer, as always, is on point. Will definitely be stopping by more this spring/summer!

Best place for live music in town. Great beer. Good BBQ food selection. I love being able to order at the counter - it seems to speed up things. The expanded size is a welcome addition, but even this place fills up very fast and it can be hard to find seats for a larger group if come too late on a busy night. It's neat seeing the owner(s) hanging out here with their friends and having a good time - it speaks more highly of a place. There's an excellent, varied, and eclectic group of music here which is very welcome. I wish that when bands are taking their breaks, there would be no music played instead of background music on their radio. The nice thing about the old place was the silence between sets to catch up on conversation. The bread part of the BBQ sandwiches could be better - it seems too thick, not soft enough, and not hot.

My girlfriend wouldn’t even kiss me after a couple of your golden ales. I almost bought some kona golden ales, which I enjoy immensely, but instead but was like well, laughing sun golden ales will be similar. 
Wrong. Wrong. Tastes like keystone light gave up.

name: Double Ditch State Recreation Area
address: Double Ditch Loop, Bismarck, ND 58503, USA
reviews: This place used to be good until everybody started coming here to walk their dogs.
Great views during a walk while learning about the early native inhabitants.
This used to be a place I'd go to get away from it all but they did some work out there to make it look pretty. Now it sees some foot traffic but is still a beautiful place
The perfect place to be "one" with Mother Earth. Visit the place and you'll agree!
Not much here. Lots of mud.

name: Pirogue Grille
reviews: Delicious! Everything was cooked to perfection. Beautiful location with excellent service and five star food. Definitely the perfect fine dining experience in Bismarck. Take your time and enjoy each and every course of delicious dining.

Food was amazing! Order the Rabbit Spoetzel (pictured) and then I had the Bison Medallions and the wife had Swordfish for main dish -it looked so great we forgot to take pictures! ...and tasted even better!! It IS abit spendy, but if you like great food -dont worry bout $$$ bill

They have wonderful food and very unique dishes to try each time we go! I enjoy the scallops with cream curry and jasmine rice while my husband likes the lamb loin. It has a very nice atmosphere as well with excellent service!
Waitress could have been a little nicer. Great food and atmosphere
Awesome service and great food!

name: Cross Ranch State Park
reviews: Loved Cross Ranch! The camping was way fun, and the main office had several activities on Friday and Saturday for the kids to do, while we were there. They will even drop you off up river so you can kayak back down again! The camp site was well keep and with plenty of space for two tents. The fire ring was also cleaned out, so we didn't have to worry about too much ash inside it. We went for a walk on one of the trails, and the view was really beautiful. We got quite a few ticks on the walk, but we were able to get rid of them all without much trouble. Definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a fun camping trip.

I have visited all of the state parks in North Dakota save one. (Graham's Island). My favorite so far is Cross Ranch. I have camped there  numerous times. For newcomers, it's a little tricky to find. It's off the beaten path for sure. But it's worth it.
   The park is divided Into two sections about three miles apart. They are connected by a trail. The smaller section cannot accommodate large RVs. 20ft. max. However, I like the smaller section better. (Also known as Sanger campground). It's very close to the Missouri River. If you like to go rafting it's perfect. There's even a rafting company in nearby Washburn, that rents rafts and will even pick you up downstream.
   The Park is open year-round with plenty of activities. There's a nice trail for cross-country skiing in the winter or hiking in the summer.
   If you're a fisherman, the Missouri River has plenty of fish. Although I am not a fisherman, I heard there's walleye! I don't like to fish but I love to eat them! Yum!
   The last time I visited, there were upgrades taking place at Sanger. Water was being installed. Electricity is available as well.  There are vault toilets. Althoughl Sanger was considered primitive, that may not be the case now.
   The park is well-maintained and the toilets are clean.
I think the best thing I like about the park is the location. Next to the Missouri River, it's awesome. I'm not the type of person that likes to go out on big water but I like the Missouri River and I'm not afraid of it. It has a slow-moving current and is very picturesque even if you don't want to get into the water. I've heard that there are bald eagles living along the river.
   If you're the type of person wanting to get away from it all, Cross ranch is the place to go!
We come here every year for the Bluegrass Festival. Good place to camp with clean facilities and a playground for the kids. Had to put up with the ticks (and tree worms this year) but still had fun.
We love camping here especially in the fall. Lots of wildlife and great trails. Friendly and helpful Park staff. Everything is well maintained
We rented a cabin cross country skiing for two days very peaceful and quiet and relaxing the staff there were a great to talk to and renting skis from them was great

name: Salem Sue
reviews: Very large cow. A good place to stop for a break. There are some picnic tables. Also, plenty of portable toilets. Lovely views all around. Great high place to take pictures from. There were some orange fencing that I did not care for. Apparently Salem Sue needs a new paint job.
Salem Sue is very impressive as well as the view from where she sits especially from the top of the hill. It was really interesting getting info on her dimensions. Highly recommended!

What a wonderful place to visit. I've seen this from the interstate many, many times and this time I finally went up the hill to see the "cow" up close. 

It was well worth the time! The view is amazing and it is a wonderful place to stop and enjoy the peace and quiet, and eat your lunch. 

Salem Sue is every inch as big as she looks. A great landmark, well kept, and not commercialized. A free will donation suffices to keep Sue in good shape. 

Take the time to visit Sue if you are in the neighborhood. I wish I had done so years ago. I won't pass her by next time.

Salem Sue (or The World's Largest Holstein Cow) is a large fiberglass Holstein cowsculpture located in New Salem, North Dakota, United States. Salem Sue was built in 1974 for $40,000. The project was sponsored by the New Salem Lions Club in honor of the local dairy farming industry. The artist was Dave Oswald and the construction was done by Sculpture Mfg. Co in La Crosse, Wisconsin. The statue stands 38 feet (12 m) high and 50 feet (15 m) long. It sits on School Hill near Interstate 94 off exit 127 S and can be viewed for several miles.

If you're traveling as a tourist on 94, there's no excuse not to take fifteen minutes of your time and drive up to see Salem Sue. A quick walk up the path gets you a fun photo op with the world's largest Holstein statue and a great view of the surrounding land. If you have a few minutes extra, walk all the way to the top of the hill and get a stunning 360 degree panorama of the area surrounding New Salem.

Free to everyone, but drop a buck or two in the donation box for Sue's upkeep.

name: Pioneer Park
reviews: Nice park

name: General Sibley Park and Campground
address: 5001 S Washington St, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: It was winter do long to of snow.  Great 24 hole disc golf course though.
I love General Sibley! It's clean n quiet. Nice frolf course and a boat ramp. Many beautiful birds to enjoy listening to. Day use and camping areas. Tenting here is awesome!
Massive Campground, beautiful clean, boat launch and water access is available. Convenient dump station yes electricity at the sites. All right close to Bismarck and Mandan

I had a great experience here!. Friendly lady ant the desk and a great camping area for our tent. We were here on the 4th of July and there was fireworks all evening at the homes around the park so that was neat.

A very well maintained park.  A peaceful place to take a break from the busy part of life and relax.  No matter if you just want a place to stop by and take a walk with your best friend or maybe spend some time taking a few photos of all the nature you will embark on upon your visit,  I am without doubt you will have a splendid time here.

name: Peacock Alley
address: 422 E Main Ave, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: In town for a family event - stopped by Peacock Alley for drinks and ended up having dinner there too.  Super wine menu.  Food was excellent.  And staff was so friendly!  When you're in Bismarck, go eat at Peacock Alley!

This place has been around for several years and moved from one location to the current one. Occupies the ground/street level of a multi-story building with apartments for the disabled on the upper floors. The main entrance opens into the bar area (tables and around the bar) with a corridor between the bar room and the sit-down restaurant. There is also an outdoor patio area. Extensive menu, lots of microbrew and we got an amazing waiter, Rudy, who made sure we got good vegetarian food. Everything he recommended was amazing. This was definitely a great choice for us!
My stake was really good cook, and awesome service, I was there like a month ago

This place is awesome. Great menu, huge beer selection and quite a few beers brewed right in house. Great place atmosphere too. I would recommend it if you are just looking for great local beer or if you want a complete pub experience.

Ordered the Salmon dinner via DoorDash for my husband while he was spending the night in Bismarck.  He called me back and said it was THE best meal he has had on the road.  The bed of spinach the salmon dinner was on was wilted perfectly and the salsa on top was fresh and delicious.   The onion rings were crispy and tasty.  He was very happy with his dinner.  And the portion was perfect for him.  

If I ever find myself in Bismarck, I will certainly stop in for a meal in person!

name: Lewis and Clark Interpretive Center
reviews: Husband and I enjoyed our short trip here at the end of the day. Wonderful exhibits, educational information, gift shop, and staff. Definitely worth a visit when you are in North Dakota.

Give it three stars because the restrooms are clean, good parking for RVs and nice sculpture art outside.  Did not go in because we had limited time and the cost is $8 per adult.  The items in gift shop were nice however also expensive.  From what I could see it looked like nice exhibits and would probably spent some time going through the center if it was $3.

I would have liked to have seen more about their winter here and their return visit. I think all the centers should just tell the story of the trio up until that spot. Kind of let each interpretive center be like a continuation from the last. This would encourage people to tour the entire trail.

Really enjoyed it, very informative.
I, also, enjoyed walking to the river on the Lewis and Clark Legacy Trail. 
The information that I found said the trail was 2.2 miles, that's 1 way, end to end; I went  a bit past the riverboat and back and went 3.5 miles. It's a very nice, easy walk with some elevation; there's, also, a Frisbee Golf course. 
The entire visitor center was well worth the stop.
Make sure you go to the Mandan Fort, also.
Great museum full of information and stories about Lewis and Clark and their journey out west.

name: Fort Mandan State Recreation Area
reviews: A great visit to though historic site and re-creation of Ft Mandan.  The tour costs $8.00 per person and covers the Interpretive Center as well as Ft. Mandan.  The ladies providing the tour were fantastic, very knowledgeable and good communicators. Don't be shy if driving a big RV and towing a car. There is a turn around loop next to Ft Mandan.  No problem with a 42 motor home towing a car.  I parked on the side of the road facing out.

It was nice. But, the fact that is was a reproduction and at a different place was a bit of a let down. But, I understand about it being lost. The inside rooms were really nice. They gave an insight to their lives in the area.

Unique fort replica (@2 miles from Lewis & Clark Interpretive Crt and museum) with history of Lewis & Clark who wintered here from 1804-1805.  The museum covers ND history, several local Indian tribes & Lewis and Clark explorers.  No discounts but only $8 pp for museum & fort tours.  Great gift shop.  Park Rangers are very nice & helpful.

We arrived after 3:00 pm, which was the last docent-led tour; however, one of the docents took us on his own tour. It was informative, and I leard a few things that I did not glean from reading "Undaunted Courage" or by watching the PBS documentary on Lewis and Clark.
Awesome recreation of Lewis and Clark's winter fort. Great tour guide gave a great lesson and answered all our questions.

name: Knife River Indian Villages National Historic Site
reviews: Initially I stopped here for the cancellation stamp in my national parks book, but this stop was so much better than I expected!  Easily one of my favorites.  Fascinating earth house model, beautiful grassy area with visible mounds where these homes used to stand (and had collapsed), extremely helpful and kind rangers, and a great museum with lots of interesting bits of information.  We even got to see some archeologists in action while we were there!  Lovely and interesting place I would highly recommend to everyone!

Nife River Indian village was nice all the facilities are clean. The walking trail is great because it had great little interesting  displays of their huts and way of life. We saw a spotted fawn really young right beside the trail
Great history to be had. Try to visualize life here in the 1790s. Camping is close by and the trails are great! Nice museum!
Very neat Indian home and several fields showing where other huts once stood.
Pretty cool place to visit. Every dip in the ground was once a house.

name: Prairie Knights Casino & Resort
reviews: It's okay, really like the size of the room & the bathroom was super nice. Casino left you desiring more tables & more drinks as it's all self serve. Non smoking slot machine area was nice, but not a lot of options. Food was decent but nothing worth remembering. Customer service was not outstanding, but employees were cordial. Recommend for something to do for one weekend but won't be back again.
The employees are super. Friendly and courteous. Always willing to help you in some way.
Fun place to get away to, but don't expect much from the amenities... very old and outdated.  It's a nice drive out from Bismarck, and something to do.

Nice clean casino. Full bar and beautiful hotel with two restaurants and food served until the wee hours. Pool and fitness room as well. For a great time and great service give this casino a try. I loved it there!
Great casino and staff. Would definitely recommend for a stay or to play.

name: Kirkwood Mall
reviews: As long as I can remember, Kirkwood Mall was the big shopping places to go when in Bismarck... a lot of businesses have left with new ones not far behind... hope they fill the Herbergers spot this summer... great place to shop..

This is an ok mall. If you want to call it that, there is not alot of store choices here. Now there is several in the area. However, you do get the small town feel, which I think is great. I hate to see these dieing off.

The few stores I was interested (Penney's and CJ Banks) in were clean and organized. The sales associates were friendly and helpful. The mall as a whole would have rec'd a five star rating but their parking lot needs potholes filled.

Back years ago this was we're everyone shopped. It was busy and so hard to park. Now this dinosaur looks so sad even thou maintained well it is over. Overpriced stores with only overpriced stock. It has only become a power walker heaven for the 60-95 age group. I love that on a cold North Dakota morning they have a warm and safe place but I know they are not shopping.
Impressive mall.   Reminds me of what a great mall looks like. Plenty of thriving stores.

name: Zorells Jewelry
reviews: I came in to have a ring setting changed. Keith was more than helpful. I didn’t know what I wanted. At the end of the day I knew I had picked the right jeweler. Very knowledgeable. Not pushy. Extremely courteous. Very impressed. I cannot wait to see my finished product.

We heard from friends (who got married a year before us) they got there ring from here and that is where we will find ours! I was skeptical at such a bold claim but, they were right and Zorells did not disappoint! Tim Jr helped us pick out the ring and he was very knowledgable and helpful! They have a great selection by the way! They made sure the ring came in before we took off to Hawii! After she said yes in Hawii, she did the usual things for brides and lost weight. Little did I know the a diet would change her finger and ring size. Zorells has been great about resizing the ring and has not charged us for it ever! (We resized the ring 3 times, every time smaller) Zorells has done a outstanding job with the ring on all fronts! I would strong encourage you to go here! (Picture does not do the ring justice! Looks way better in real life!)
Hannah, my "sales" lady was very knowledgable and patient...I really liked the fact that she was not pushy in the least.

The staff at Zorell’s are awesome! They always take care of me and have an awesome selection of jewelry. Their new store is amazing and worth a visit. Also, thanks to Jeff for the speedy repair to my bracelet!

Pam was absolutely wonderful to work with. She took the time to help us fill out a wish list for my wife and show us new interesting pieces specific to her taste. The jeweler/goldsmith is the greatest!!! He buffed, polished, and replaced a diamond in my wife's wedding set. She was thrilled to get her ring back in new condition. Her smile sparkeled as bright as her ring. Thank you, Zorells!

name: Lake Sakakawea State Park
reviews: Very peaceful and beautiful too. This is one of the nicest state parks in the west I've seen. Even if you don't get out on the lake it's a great place to hang out and watch the world go by.

Favorite campground and have been coming here for years with my family.  Love the super friendly staff and the fact the camp sites are spread out.  Love to get out in the evenings to catch the wild life.  The park and the comfort stations are very well taken care of. If you like to hike there are plenty of groomed trails to get out on.   Best of all, mother nature creates some beautiful picture taking opportunities!
And fishing here before pretty good place to go good place for family under the sun tried out you might like it
Just beautiful and so much to do!
Beautiful park.  Well maintained.  RV park is no cell but they need sewers.  The comfort station has three women's stalls and two showers.  Good hot water, low water pressure.

name: Lewis and Clark Riverboat
address: N, 1700 River Rd, Bismarck, ND 58503, USA
reviews: The drinks are fairly priced and the trip is long enough to relax, but not long enough to get bored. Don't go during the hot parts of the day because there's no AC.

This is such a waste of money!!! The history was a joke. Two or three minutes of history and then it repeats. We drove up the river less than a mile and circled back. The went the other way. The beer is cheap. Get there earlier to get seat on top.
Gorgeous views and courteous staff.
It's a wonderful place to enjoy the river
Very cool and smooth ride.  The boat was nice, well kept, friendly staff and crew.  I sat on the top deck directly in front of the captains helm. It was a great experience.

name: Bismarck Event Center
reviews: The new addition is clean and looks really nice up to date. Its great for the smaller events that they hold. I wish they would get more big name concerts like Fargo dome does. Great place for events the food and drinks could be a little cheaper though. Just be aware they close off part of the south parking lot during concerts, rodeos,  monster trucks, etc. which can make it very difficult to maneuver in the parking lot.

I was a vendor at the Pride of Dakota in December of 2019. The staff is very friendly directing you once you pull into the parking lot. I love how you can pull your car inside to unload.  Especially in December. Great place to be a vendor as many people attend from the surrounding towns.
Great meeting place. Nice atmosphere, temperature and walking around space at break time. Clean.
I went to the tribes pow wow. It was an experience, I never seen so many dancers and all looking so beautiful. Plus some of their dance contest were different,  I loved it.

This place is very disappointing. I honestly don't know why the city decided to build the new addition when they can't fill the current venue. The staff can not get new artists. All they want in there is old outdated artists that would be better off at a casino or a county fair. When they do have great bands like, Avenged Sevenfold, Five Finger Death Punch ect, they act like they're afraid of them. The community wants better and newer groups, not musical's, plays, ballet, piano artists that are the same every freaking year!

name: McDowell Dam Recreation Area
reviews: We love to take our dogs to walk here its perfect!!
Beautiful little out of the way park.  Nice lake and picnic spots.  Nice restrooms.  Paved walking path around the park.  Dogs on leash welcome
Nice place to visit.

Convenient, clean water recreation area.  

Even if the fish are not biting, good times.

Very clean beach with good sand. Good place to swim or rent a kayak. Kayak rental prices were very reasonable and the girl there that helped us was very friendly. Bathrooms were a little questionable.

name: The Enchanted Highway
reviews: Beautiful drive with amazing art sculptures all along the way.  Plenty of parking at each sculpture location as well as picnic tables and some play equipment for the kids at some.  Awesome ride!

We loved the Enchanted Highway. It was amazing to meet Gary! Here's the beautiful tree outside the gift shop! Tour the great state of North Dakota and make sure you have this on the list! We're going to stay at the Enchanted Castle the next time we're through!

Fascinating story, stop in to the Enchanted Castle hotel and have Gary tell you his story. The Enchanted Highway is a work of love and determination. Gary and a small group of farmers are working to save the small farming community and they found a interesting and creative way to accomplish this. Hearing the story is worth the trip.
What a neat concept. My kids loved getting their pix next to each sculpture.
A super fun drive along scenic roads. The sculptures are super interesting and fun to look at.

name: Assumption Abbey
reviews: Did not go inside but had to stop when I saw the beautiful architecture on this church an amazing building worth the stop to take 5 minutes out of your day
Always awesome. Historic. Benedictine hospitality. Beautiful prairie.
Beautiful and full of grace. Was the home of one of my most favorite people.

Wonderful Wonderful  .
Holy,Holy,Holy is the Lord Jesus. Hallelujah❤🎶
A must visit when passing through Richardson! A truly special and interesting place.

name: Belle Mehus Auditorium
reviews: A delightful night of beautiful music in a first class venue. Our balcony seats afforded excellent acoustics, unimpeded view of the stage, and reasonably comfortable seats. I'm not petite, so shoulder room was wanting. We sat right of the stage, about as far right as you can get. There are two more sections of balcony seating behind us and I could image the view would be great. I bought the tickets two weeks before the performance of Bismarck-Mandan Symphony's American Pie concert. I think that might have been just a tad late. Still, great selection. Looking forward to our next visit.
Wonderful venue for concerts and other performances!
Watched The Dakota Film Festival and it was very enjoyable.
Had a great time but was disappointed that only one Pop machine and it broke down
I Love This Historic Place. it's just Sooo Beautiful. I recommend if you like Beauty, Then Check it out ! Esp. When "Surprise Church" is @ It.

name: Theodore Roosevelt National Park
reviews: When I was working in North Dakota, I always looked forward to hiking and fishing. I saw all there was of Theodore Roosevelt National Park, hiking it, or just driving around. Saw some incredible bison breeding behavior. Some of the views in the park are unrivaled.

Theodore Roosevelt National Park is a true hidden gem!   Love the bison and wild horses, especially.  Best part is many good hiking trails and not very many people.  The rangers at the visitor center are wonderful!
It's North Dakota, right???    But wow.  A must see place... And get it at sunset too.   Great picture taking location.      Bring food and water though because there's nothing around

Theodore Roosevelt National Park is a hidden gem!   One of the most intimate of all the national parks, it boasts many hiking trails of various lengths and levels.   Be prepared to see American Bison in their natural habitat of the nineteenth century, comical prairie dogs in extensive ‘towns’, wild horses roaming and running with freedom, along with elk, antelope, deer, coyotes, rattlesnakes, and more!   Walk in the footsteps of Theodore Roosevelt, where he ranched and wrote prolifically.  The history of this area is impactful beyond what most people realize.  Stop at the visitor centers to visit with super friendly and knowledgeable staff. Don’t miss this National Park!

An amazing national park. Views unbelievably gorgeous, expansive. Saw bison, coyote, wild horses, deer, prairie dog cities and cool looking birds. Drive through of park is good but best vantage point is buck hill and a short climb up a asphalt trail.

name: Badlands Overlook
reviews: Beautiful scenic drive worth a stop. We saw buffaloo up close, a coyote crossed the road in front of us with her pup, and absolutely loved the fields of squeaking prairie dogs
Amazing beauty and so worth the trip
Last point to view TRNP on the southern loop as the road is it the last few miles. Absolutely gorgeous!
Beautiful place to drive and hike.
Gorgeous view , always something new each drive through.

name: Scandinavian Heritage Association
reviews: Very nice!  Great for people to learn a few things about Scandinavian heritage. The monuments, statues and buildings show beautiful heritage.

I absolutely love this place. You need to visit this place in July when all the walkways are filled with flowers. Its a stunning park. Its great if you want to walk the paths enjoying the weather, or a place to have lunch on many of the tables scattered around, or just hang out in general. One of Minots best places to be.
Nice little place to visit while in Minot.  Just wish that the buildings had been open to go inside.  Gift shop was fun.
Such a beautiful park with water features,  amazing buildings statuary and flowers! Makes you proud to be Scandinavian!

Wonderful, unique place to learn about the cultures of Denmark, Sweden, Norway, Iceland, and Finland. We recently visited there with my husband's parents and our children.It's so fun to look for trolls, and our youngest enjoyed roleplaying the Three Billy Goats Gruff across the bridges! I love the natural wood smell inside the Gol Stave Church - and the carvings are intricate and beautiful. It's a very peaceful place, and the volunteers I've met there have been very friendly and knowledgeable. One of my favorite statues is the one of Hans Christian Andersen. You can see some hints of his stories in the statue, like a duckling and a pair of scissors. Sometimes the sauna door is open so you can see the sunlight streaming through the beautiful stained glass windows. Don't forget to check out the Heritage House a short walk down the road from the cabin - I overlooked it the first time I visited the park.
The gift shop area is fairly small, and doubles as the Visitor's Center for Minot, but there is still a great variety of trinkets, t-shirts, gifts, books, and treats. Definitely check out the toffee chocolate bar from Iceland; it's one of the most expensive chocolate bars I've ever bought, but soooooo very worth it! (Actually, don't  - if there's more demand the price will go up and I'll only be able to get it at Christmas!)

name: National Buffalo Museum
reviews: Cute place! Great for families, couples, or groups. I highly recommend the gift shop before the Jamestown village, the people who run it are lovely. The giant buffalo is a must see along with the buffalo family at the gift shop! P.S. if you see the buffalo, buy a feed bag for 50¢ from the front counter... they love it!
A bit pricey, with buffalo were a little closer. But loved the experience!
I enjoyed this place. Small but good. I think kids would enjoy a stop here. Very affordable. Plus, there is an observation deck to look at the buffalo. The gift shop has great gifts too.

Wife wanted to see the world's largest buffalo 😉
We were on our way to Bismarck from Fargo and Jamestown seemed like a good place to pullover for a break.  Google Maps directions took us along a gravel road to get here but upon leaving my TomTom GPS avoided that gravel road.
This museum has a building that serves as the "main" museum that has a gift shop and you pay/donate to go through the exhibits but there is also an outside "town" to walk through (most buildings have a donation box) and step into some of the buildings that are on "display" with furniture, manikins, etc.
At one end of the town is a playground/picnic area and a path leading to the world's largest buffalo.  There are two pay binoculars here to use to see the buffalo nearby is desired.
Parking is free, we parked near the chapel and I believe I saw a handicap spot here as well and perhaps near the museum as well?  Some folks just drove to the end of the town, made a u-turn and drove back.  It wasn't too busy when we visited.

This is the second time we have stopped in on our travels. Love being able to see the buffalo and enjoy the walk around the town. The museum has a great little free library and the tour inside is very informative. We really enjoy the walk around the Frontier Village also.

name: Beaver Lake State Park
reviews: Campground is great, but bring a 50 foot hose if you are camping. The water hookup is far away.
Good place for camping. This park is in bortle scale class 2 dark sky, for people like astrophotography this gonna be the right place for you.

We almost had the place to ourselves because It was almost off season. 
   The shower house is awesome. It's heated and neat as a pin.
   The park is well maintained. Only one employee on hand but she stopped by to see if we needed anything.
   Self check in wasn't tough. You need a cell phone though and a credit card with this method. Check or cash are accepted as well with a drop box. No cell phone needed with this method. Honor system somewhat.
   A nice dock for fishing but you can't eat the fish because of algae problem.
   This place is very dark at night with not much lighting. 🔦 Flashlights are advisable.
  "Drive thru" style campsites. Picnic benches, as with most state parks, are supplied with nice fire boxes for cooking. Electricity as well with clean outhouses nearby.
Great place. We only stayed a quick night driving cross country.
Nice and clean Park. Shower Room is perfect 👍🏻 Very quiet and we feel safe in the area. Staff are nice too

name: Trapped in Bismarck
address: 3333 E Broadway Ave #1219, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: We went here with a group of 6 and did the mafia room. It was way to many people for this room. The game maker for the room was not a very pleasant person. She was very unfriendly whenever we tried to joke with her and when she gave any clues they were usually delivered in a very condescending manner. At the end we laughed about how many times she just said rude comments like "Does anyone in this group know how to open a lock?" And "Uhhh you have to hand it to me..." I feel like this is a great addition to Bismarck and I hope I continues to improve. It could start with training the staff to be a little more upbeat and friendly or at least able to give information in a less rude manner. I've done multiple escape rooms in Minneapolis and each time the game maker is the person who made a huge difference in how enjoyable the experience is. It's not a good feeling to already feel lost then look over and see this unfriendly person judging you. I will also add that one of the boxes was missing a lock and the employee straight up told us that if she hadn't forgotten the lock we would have never escaped. She wanted me to include her name in the review because she apparently gets bonuses based on reviews but I don't think she wants her name on this one.

We escaped the Z.M.B. Virus Trials featuring Jordan as The Patient in 51:16! Super fun and great puzzles! The Patient was funny and scary but not freeky. Had a great time and recommend Trapped in Bismarck to anyone who likes puzzles or games!

Highly recommend Trapped if your looking for something fun to do with a group! Our Guide was great, gave us clues just when we needed them, we didn't "escape" but she did walk us through it in the end and explained what we missed, ect. Great place, great staff!
We did a room one night and had so much fun we went back the next day and did two more!! Jordan was fantastic and we were able to escape all 3 rooms!! Would definitely go back!! Go Team Megadesk!!!

I came here with a group of friends and had so much fun. All the puzzles were fun to figure out And the storyline was cool. Our guide Anna was hilarious and fun. She helped us pass the room and made us laugh along the way. I definitely will be coming back here again

name: Paul Broste Rock Museum
reviews: Very educational and the kids enjoyed it. This place has a great collection and exhibits with interesting rock formations.

Awesome place for those interested in the earth and what she puts out. (Rocks)   Love rocks myself so this was an awesome place. Miss Joyce was very informative about the whole place. When we come back to Stanley we will be back. Thank you Mods Joyce. 😉🌻
Photos do not do justice to this local geological treasure. The museum is worth a special trip. Nothing else in the world like the Infinity Room.
This is an incredible place; well worth the effort to go to Parshall and see. Doris gave us an excellent tour with history of the museum and knowledge of the rocks.
Charoyal and Doris are the best! and most informative regarding this museum and the area.  The museum is worth the $5 admission.  A must visit.

name: LÜFT Rooftop Bar
address: 510 E Main Ave, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: Aesthetically appealing but service was fair (had to order everything at the bar) and food was only okay.  The worst part was the constant stream of rednecks driving up and down main street in obnoxiously loud and smelly vehicles. As an "outside" visitor, this reflected quite poorly on the community.

Really cool rooftop bar. Just 3rd story, but on a nice day it’s beautiful. Cool bartender named Henry from my home state of Texas!!! Awesome service and great craft cocktails. Also, a pretty good selection of craft beers and local brews. Nice place, I’d hang here if I were a local. Thanks guys!

I’ve been here several times and the food has always been great as well as the drinks. Tonight I had the humps burger and truffle fries and once again I’m blown away at the quality of this “bar food”. AMAZING! Best burger I have had in Bismarck for sure!
One of my favorite places in Bismarck. Great for weekends. Usually pretty light on bat traffic. The summer you can hang out outside.

One of the nicest bars in town. Decor is like the San Francisco area, and they have fire pits to keep warm outside at night. Plus the view is great, not many other bars let see all of downtown. But this place is limited by the bathroom selection. Durring peak hours their is usually a line, and the extra bathrooms are down the elevator (or stairs is your in a hurry).
Edit, there's another bathroom on the left hand side. Five stars!

name: Jumped-Up
address: 2390 E Bismarck Expy, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: Had a birthday party their today and what a great experience! At the door they even provided masks if you were feeling under the weather or wanted to be cautious! Hand sanitizer was provided through out the building. And the employees were spraying Lysol periodically! Very impressed!
Great place for a birthday party. Our group had a blast!

Had our daughter's birthday party here.  It was absolutely perfect for a bunch of kindergarteners. Everyone went home happy and tired.  Very nice and clean facility, and extremely helpful staff. I'd highly recommend for a party, or if your little one needs to run off some steam on a cold winter day!

My son and I have only been here once or twice and haven't been here for nearly 2 years but the owner remembered us from our prior visit. A very fun atmosphere, always clean, and the staff is always friendly. Would recommend to anyone with children

This place is awesome. First time coming here and we will definitely come back. Our son loved it, and for the price it was worth every penny. Is a great way to burn that extra energy off kids seem to always have.

name: Roosevelt Park Zoo Office
address: 1219 E Burdick Expy, Minot, ND 58701, USA
reviews: Extremely sad... the tiger was pacing because it was extremely stressed out (along with no mental/physical stimulation) in it's small, muddy "enclosure" with nothing but wooden stumps around in it... the okapi was closed in a small room with ONLY a little bit of sawdust in the room, nothing else.... that was the final straw for me (among several other things) in my 20 min visit that caused me to abruptly leave. No photos because frankly it was too sad to take any. I do not expect this to be like the Zoos in San Diego, Toledo, etc... but they should at least be able to properly accommodate their animals... would give 0 stars if I could.

Cute little zoo, but I feel the cages need to be.bigger for certain animals but I do like the setup as how they have cages going across trees for the
Lemers and Monkeys which is cool but for the bigger Animals, I feel they need bigger cages. Still a nice place to go on a little adventure.

This zoo is making huge improvements to the animal enclosures right now. The new enclosures are beautiful and what these animals deserve. The landscaping and upkeep of the zoo is just beautiful and really well cared for. The zookeepers love to share knowledge and help families get to know the animals better!
Beautiful zoo. Many animal exhibits, many activities for children an adults. Well done!

This is such a nice zoo! It's better than some of the zoo's I've been to in cities twice Minots size. They have a kids train zoo tour (I think its $5) and concessions and bathrooms throughout. There are lions, tigers, bears,giraffes, monkeys, lemurs, penguins, some local wildlife(wolves, buffalo, etc) and much more! It's in Roosevelt park, which is a beautiful park and also has a public pool. Highly recommend!

name: Oxbow Overlook
reviews: Beautiful culmination to the 14 mile road travelling through Theodore Roosevelt National Park.  You can see for miles and look down into what my family calls the baby Grand Canyon. There is access to trails for hiking and enough parking to make it convenient.
Great camper spots, nice RV parking, a lot of buffalo or bison. Just wow !
Just love this place and will be back
This overview and hike is amazing! Unforgettable... Got rained on.
One of the top 3 views in the park that do not require any hiking.

name: Welk Homestead State Historic Site
reviews: Beautiful place. Very informative staff.

I stopped in the winter,I had drove by lots of times and finally drove out to see it.
   Pretty cool
If you are old enough to remember Lawrence Welk, you will love the Welk homestead
Interesting stop. Very comfortable, self-paced, walkable and flat terrain. Would see again gladly.
A fun history lesson on the the settlers of the ND prairie and the early life of Lawrence Welk.

name: Butterhorn
address: 210 E Main Ave, Bismarck, ND 58501, USA
reviews: Loved this place. Really nice atmosphere and the food was delicious. It is on the more expensive side, but is so worth it. The food is very filling. I went with several people and we shared a little bit of everyone's dish so we could try many things. I recommend their butter roll and the apple tart. Both were very delicious.

Let's do brunch!  Today I had the Eggs Benedict (very good), but my husband always has the biscuits and gravy.  Says next to his favorite Aunts, the Butterhorn makes the best around!  And he's tried them all.

Best place to eat in town. Amazing food. Wonderful date venue. Butterhorns are warm and delicious. The service and food presentation is excellent. Everything tastes so wonderful and love the unique combinations of different foods together. They perfectly balance sweet and savory foods for a one of a kind tasty entree.

Very nice place. Extremely friendly and competent people working there. The butterhorns were fantastic as was the pasta. We had a wonderful anniversary celebration and were treated so very well. Kudos to ALL!
Excellent food and service. Loved the pear and arugula salad, walleye cakes and beef tenderloin. Only wish the serving size was a bit larger on the tenderloin for $35...

name: Walrus Restaurant
reviews: it has 3feet on the best way for you in this country and to be the best way for you to the right person to the right of the city to get the best way for them to get the right people to the party is the fact that means that you're going out with a friend who has a good time and to you and to the people that are doing it has become the best thing for you to have 3to 3 or more in the same place you have at the time and don't have to worry too hard about it and to be the best way in the game and the other thing that means you're a great player and to have a good 423time 353feet in this world 4will 4the game 4will and to have a lot more to 4be is a great way for you guys 4in the ball 4to in a game where you can be the most important person in 4this to the right 4th and to be sure you can play the best way in this world series for the next three games and a lot more than the best of us all season for you in this country where the best place to

I’m a particular guest in that I don’t like my food items to touch each other on the plate. I order accordingly & politely ask for what I need to make the dining experience happy. I was a server for years & get it. At the Walrus there was so much potential for it to be great.... but alas it was a hot mess. Timing was off. Food all came touching & everyone made me feel like it was my fault my order wasn’t as I ordered it to be. Zero apologies or attempts to remedy. No adjustments on price. We had a large tab & I didn’t tip, super rare for me. The staff were not on the same page & definitely not trying to make sure the guest was happy. Would not do this again & I was disappointed.

Cozy environment with truly personal service. Everything my family has tried on the menu tastes great. If you want to try something original but amazing, go for the crispy ravioli appetizer! They named some of their meals after their family pets like the Bailey which is a fully loaded burger. Any time you come, You will see the owner and manager Jill Sanford helping serve and deliver delicious meals. It’s a must stop if you want to have a Bismark experience.

Nice American style restaurant in Bismarck. They're menu has a solid selection of American style food to pick from, but what really won me over was their selection of craft beers. Their staff was friendly, and had great recommendations for what beers to order. Next time I'm in Bismarck I for sure will stop in again.
Just had curb side from The Walrus. Our food was out quickly and still hot when we arrived at home. Tasty as always. Delicious again.  Will do this as long as is required.

name: La Carreta Mexican Restaurant
address: 505 E Bismarck Expy, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: Just ordered it very first take out from La Carreta. Have eaten in before... Perfect. Excellent. Would recommend this Mexican food restaurant to everyone.

Service was fast and the food was excellent. I had the Chile Verde and my wife has the carnitas. The meat was super tender and flavorful. The margaritas we ordered were perfectly made. Would definitely recommend!

Go here for lunch. I've had several lunch menu items. I've never been disappointed and the prices is really good. Huge portions for under $10 weekday lunches. They also have really good complimentary chips and salsa.
BEST IN BISMARCK. AUTHENTIC AND GREAT TASTING FOOD. I GET ARROZ CON POLLO EVERY TIME. 😃

You have not LIVED till you've tried La Carreta's food. The food is excellent and the price is cheap for how good it is. If I want Mexican food I will no longer go anywhere else! The service is also wonderful such friendly staff!

name: Fireflour Pizzeria & Coffee Bar
reviews: I've been coming here pretty much since they opened. The food is delicious and fresh. If you want a great pizza, you've found it. They also have coffee and house-made gelato. You're missing out if you haven't visited Fireflour. Don't forget the MexiCoke!

This is how they did our buy one get one free coupon. $13.50 + $15.50 + $10 = $39 + a 20% tip + tax = $50.54. My total for 1 pizza and a salad came to $35!! You know you're scamming people. The 20% tip should be after the coupon is taken off and so should the tax.  That's ridiculous - $35 for one pizza and a salad. Plus you didn't reply to your message on Facebook. Quit taking advantage of your customers like that.  Not cool. The owner did reach out to me and refunded over $8.00 I appreciate that!

I absolutely LOVE this place! My husband and I meet here for weekly dates, and it never gets old.  We highly recommend the Daisy with chili oil! We also add the fennel sausage to that. It is incredible. And to top it off you can add freshly made gelato and a latte!

The barista/server was really nice and sweet. She helped explain anything my party and I had questions on. The pizza was absolutely amazing. You could tell it was all handmade. The coffees we ordered were all delicious. It was over all great service.

The pizzas were okay at best. They lacked flavor and toppings. There was hardly any sauce on either one of our pizzas. They were pretty expensive as well being around 20 dollars per pizza for GF. They were roughly 12 inches in size. The service and staff were good, our waitress did a good job, and the pizzas came out fast. My wife ordered mocha latte and it came out more milk than coffee. We probably will not go back as there are other options that work better for us.

name: Kobe’s Japanese Steak House and Sushi Bar
address: 915 W Interstate Ave, Bismarck, ND 58503, USA
reviews: LOVE this place! My favorite sushi place in the nation!! I stop by at least once everytime I come into town.
I would normally be giving 4-5 stars...I LOVE Kobe's...but this time I found metal in my edamame...please make sure the staff is being more careful...consuming metal is a terrifying thought.

Favorite sushi spot in Bismarck and Mandan. The Hibachi grill is always a blast when you have a party - business or personal. We almost always start with a King Crab Crunch roll, then order from the grill. Soup comes with the order. Always pleasant service and the food is delicious. Great place for bringing doubters to try sushi for the first time. Plus, call ahead to book a table Friday & Saturday. Even thirty minutes ahead can save you a lot of waiting.
Always fast service with a smile. Prompt preparation of the food.

Love the hibachi chicken and rice.   Great family atmosphere.  My daughter is home from college and was craving the chicken fried rice.  I got her take out and surprised her with her favorite meal when I walked in the door at home. Kobe’s has a fast and friendly pick up service.  I highly recommend Kobe’s for dine in or dining out.

name: LongHorn Steakhouse
address: 1070 E Interstate Ave, Bismarck, ND 58503, USA
reviews: We went to Longhorn Steakhouse on ND Smart Restart (5/1) and were extremely impressed with how well they handled the reopening.  The measures they have taken to make sure that everyone is safe and comfortable while serving wonderful food was amazing. Kudos Longhorn!
Great atmosphere. Excellent service. Food cooked to perfection.

I enjoyed my flat iron steak medium rare. The menu gives accurate guidance of how they cook the steaks.  The hosts accommodated my seating request within reason.  It was clean, everyone was polite. The menu can be compatible with a low carb diet.

In comparison to Texas Roadhouse on service and food, this place loses big time, especially since both experiences are similarly priced. The environment in Longhorns is quiet and rustic and more sophisticated, but it doesn't make up for the amount of blah-ness on a menu. Even the burgers are blah. The two stand out items on their menu is The Longhorn and the onion petals.

The parmesan crusted chicken is the main reason I come here. It is so amazing. The steakhouse mac & cheese is amazing as well. I have not had a bad meal here. Service was good and the restaurant was clean. The loaf of bread at the beginning has been slightly hit and miss. Texas roadhouse offers better buns with cinnamon butter.

name: HuHot Mongolian Grill
address: Kirkwood Mall, 409 S 3rd St, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: The food is fantastic and the staff was friendly. So why the three star review? Cleanliness of the restaurant. The eating area was clean and tidy but the bathrooms, on multiple occasions, were overly dirty. I understand that it's something that is hard to keep up on but definitely ruins your appetite. Any time my friends and I have gone here, at least one of us gets sick. It could just be coincidence but it never happens at any other restaurant we go to.
Awesome food. Great service and friendly staff. Certainly a must try if you are in the neighborhood.

To tell the truth, was very disappointed in the quality and quantity of the food. Most containers were empty and the area was dirty. I gave a three instead of a two because of the cook. He was very personable and entertaining.

Now this is good food. Load up a bowl with everything you think is tasty, drown it in one of their many sauces, and watch them cook it up for you. Then go back and do it again as many times as your body can handle. Who wouldn't love it?

Food was so delicious. The cooks were very friendly and made sure we felt welcomed. It was my niece's birthday and they made sure to tell us that the next time we went through the line, they'd do a birthday flame for her and proceeded to sing to her. Definitely recommend HuHot.

name: Sickies Garage Burgers & Brews
reviews: Very good food. Deep fried ham and cheese with a raspberry dipping sauce 😋. Fried pickles one of my favorites. Even though not in Wisconsin their cheese curds were on point. Would definitely recommend and will be back.

This place is amazing! Busy on the weekends. The menu has a variety of burgers and chicken sandwiches, a large selection of sauces for wings and dipping sauces! Great atmosphere with numerous TVs displaying different sporting event. Love the employees, most are super friendly and happy to be here.

We are rating at 2 stars because we never received our appetizers, or food. The place has a nice atmosphere, and the menu looked wonderful. After 45 minutes of waiting for just the appetizer, we left. 
Our server was nice, but we were unable to get any information as to why we never got our order. I literally got up and stood next to the server and attempted to speak to her, but she apparently didn't notice I had been standing there. 
Normally, one would ask the customer, or say, " let me check on your order"
Food was very good. Service was wonderful. From the time we ordered until the time we received our food was maybe 10 minutes.

After just over 20 minutes of sitting without even so much as anyone asking if I wanted a drink, I left. I had no less than 4 servers look at me and never so much as acknowledge me. One was busy sitting at a table with his friends. Yes, sitting at the table with them. Menu looked awesome. Too bad I wont go back to try it. Atmosphere was cool, but loud, very loud.

name: The Toasted Frog
reviews:
The response that Toasted Frog has shown to the COVID-19 pandemic is above and beyond. 

I love to visit for the great apps and martinis, but I love them even more for being a caring and responsible employer. No wonder their employees give great service! They are respected and valued. 

Kudos, Toasted Frog!

My favorite happy hour down town! From 4-6 PM all beers and martinis are on sale with amazing discounts on delicious food. Parking can be a headache before 5. Not a fast food destination. Love the wings during HH.

The servers were excellent and we loved the atmosphere! Our only complaint was how spicy some of the food was. Our favorite shoestring fries were so spicy I couldn't eat very many, and they took over the flavor of the fish in my fish & chips...  my husband's salmon was also overpowered by the spice.  My son had the sweet potato fries and had the same complaint.  Next time we'll ask for plain salt!

I went to this restaurant and they treated me like a king. I walked in there and the hostess said, "Look, there's Luke Skywalker, the savior of the galaxy." I said, "Yes, it is I." I didn't need any food, I just needed a place for Han to land the Millennium Falcon." They said, "Sure, but we are going to have to charge you an overnight parking fee." I asked them if republic credits would work and they refused them. So I left and went back home to Tatooine.

What a good selection!!!  The waitress was outstanding, she took the time to explain everything and was very accommodating.  She even gave me a pitcher of water instead of letting my glass get low.  The pizza was good, the caprese salad was really good too.  Atmosphere was as expected.

name: The Bistro
address: 1102 E Front Ave, Bismarck, ND 58504, USA
reviews: Was a great place to go and meet friends.  Always great service  and food

The service was outstanding. We sat out on the patio and our server checked on us frequently. The beer was cold and he made sure our glasses were refreshed often. I had the seared kangaroo tenderloins and they were fabulous! I highly recommend them. My sister had the lobster bisque and said it was very good. The food quantity was more than sufficient and the food quality was superb.
